body.subsection: The jcanephora package implements a set of abstractions over OpenGL with the intention of providing an API that enforces program correctness statically.

ul.li: Orthographic and perspective projection matrix creation.
Simple "look at" implementation for writing 3D cameras.
Typed cursor implementation for easy and safe vertex buffer object initialization/modification.
Shader compilation management, including on-demand shader recompilation.
Convenient and safe interface to query the names and types of shader parameters.
Transparent and "secure" shader loading from the filesystem or archives.

Interface enforces static type safety: It's no longer possible to accidentally mix up the various "indices" that the OpenGL API uses (programs, vertex shaders, fragment shaders, vertex buffer objects, index buffer objects...).
Interface enforces consistent semantics across OpenGL implementations.
Interface enforces a "fail early and fail loudly" style of programming: reducing the "silent failure" model of OpenGL programming is a priority.
Portable (tested on Linux, Mac OS X, Solaris, Windows XP). Platforms currently limited to those supported by LWJGL and/or JOGL.
